result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Mena E Adlam was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mena E Adlam appeared by video from WMHI.  Victim is also present; Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant consents to appearing by video today, however requests to appear in person for any future hearings.  Court recites history of case and questions defendant regarding right to representation, Statements from defendant; Defendant confirms that Dr report has been received and reviewed.  Defendant requests an second opinion/additional evaluation be ordered. Court orders an additional examination be prepared and appoints an examiner; Defendant is in agreement to appearing by video for the adjourned hearing and Court will review w/ defendant desire to appear in person for any future hearings and whether or not defendant wishes to be represented by counsel.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Alyssa M. Schaller for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def appearing in person per her request.  Evidentiary hearing on def's petition for conditional release.  Court questions def.  WITNESS:  Dr. Kostyshyna (via video).  Court takes judicial notice of Document 125.  WITNESS:  Dr Collins.  Court takes judicial notice of Document 115 & Document 107.  WITNESS:  Mena A.  Court puts findings on the record and denies def's petition for conditional release.  Court addresses letter filed by def on 5-28-21 re "substitution request"; court is unclear what def's request is but indicates if this is a request for substitution of Judge Giernoth, court finds issue is untimely and was previously addressed.  Court also addresses statement and letter from DHS filed 4-26-21 & 5-25-21, indicating absent State bringing motion, etc the Court is not in any position to take action; all orders stand for themselves.

Per phone call from def, she was informed Judge reviewed letter of 5-28 (confirmed it was the letter referenced in v/m) and indicated no action would be taken.  Def also informed, per her request, OTP has been prepared so she will be brought in person for the hearing on 6-16-21.
Order to Produce

Per voicemail from def, she wants to appear in person for hearing on 6-16-21; DA notified to do OTP.
Additionally, clerk attempted to return call to def, however, when using phone number provided, clerk was then given a number to a pay phone that no one answered.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Eileen T. Evans.  Atty Peter Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP. Court proceeds with hearing re revocation of conditional release.  WITNESSES:  Kim B (case manager ACC); Sherry K (probation agent).  Court questions case manager.  WITNESS:  Mena A.  Court determines that def was placed on conditional release 10-22-14.  Court puts findings on record and orders def be placed into institutional care w/order for involuntary medication until/unless def petitions for conditional release - Sheriff to transport to institute as designated by DHS; bond revoked and def remanded to jail until admission occurs.

Def in person & by Atty Eileen T. Evans.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  State does not contest NGI finding in report.  Court amends conditions of bond.  Case to be recalled.  CASE RECALLED.  Plea questionnaire form now reviewed by def (previously read to her by counsel).  Def enters no contest plea to Ct 1, Ct 2, Ct 3.  Court finds def NGI on Ct 1, Ct 2, Ct 3.  Court orders def committed to DHS for 16 yrs, 6 mos, with 1 day credit.  Court orders conditional release plan be prepared.  Court admonishes def re terms of bond in effect.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.
